intro: Lychnophora brunioides var. alpestris, commonly known as the alpine lychnophora, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
